intro: Sebaea laxa, commonly known as the slender sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other related species. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are simple and opposite, often covered in fine hairs. Sebaea laxa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
